label: ham
subject:
Rev 256: added tdb_chainlock_mark() call,
	which can be used to mark a chain locked without actually locking
	it. This will be used to guarantee forward progress in the
	ctdb non-blocking lockwait code in http://samba.org/~tridge/ctdb
body: 1 (return) [ In Cyrene, they massacred 220,000 Greeks; in Cyprus, 240,000; in Egypt, a very great multitude. Many of these unhappy victims were sawn asunder, according to a precedent to which David had given the sanction of his example. The victorious Jews devoured the flesh, licked up the blood, and twisted the entrails like a girdle round their bodies. See Dion Cassius, l. lxviii. p. 1145. * Note: Some commentators, among them Reimar, in his notes on Dion Cassius think that the hatred of the Romans against the Jews has led the historian to exaggerate the cruelties committed by the latter. Don. Cass. lxviii. p. 1146.ÑG.]
